refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: The b10-xfrin daemon provides the BIND 10 incoming DNS zone transfer service. Normally it is started by the b10-init8 process. When triggered it can request and receive a zone transfer and store the zone in a BIND 10 zone data source.

The b10-xfrin daemon supports both AXFR and IXFR. Due to some implementation limitations of the current development release, however, it only tries AXFR by default, and care should be taken to enable IXFR. See the BIND 10 Guide for more details.
This daemon communicates with BIND 10 over a b10-msgq8 C-Channel connection. If this connection is not established, b10-xfrin will exit.
b10-xfrin receives its configurations from b10-cfgmgr8.

refsect1.title: CONFIGURATION AND COMMANDS
refsect1.para: transfers_in defines the maximum number of inbound zone transfers that can run concurrently. The default is 10.

zones is a list of zones known to the b10-xfrin daemon. The list items are: name (the zone name), class (defaults to IN), master_addr (the zone master to transfer from), master_port (defaults to 53), use_ixfr (defaults to false), and tsig_key (optional TSIG key name to use). The tsig_key is specified using a name that corresponds to one of the TSIG keys configured in the global TSIG key ring (/tsig_keys/keys).

notify is sent by b10-zonemgr8 when a DNS NOTIFY message is received to initiate a zone transfer.
This is an internal command and not exposed to the administrator.

refresh triggers the transfer in for a single zone. It is the same as retransfer except it checks the SOA serial first.
This is an internal command and not exposed to the administrator.

refresh_from_zonemgr is sent by b10-zonemgr8 according to the SOA's REFRESH time to tell b10-xfrin that the zone needs to do a zone refresh. This is an internal command and not exposed to the administrator.

retransfer triggers the transfer in for a single zone without checking the zone's serial number. It has the following arguments: zone_name to define the zone to request, zone_class to define the class (defaults to IN), master to define the IP address of the authoritative server to transfer from, and port to define the port number on the authoritative server (defaults to 53). If the address or port is not specified, it will use the value previously defined in the zones configuration.
shutdown stops all incoming zone transfers and exits b10-xfrin. (Note that the b10-init process will restart this service.)

note.para: This prototype version uses SQLite3 as its data source backend. Future versions will be configurable, supporting multiple data storage types.

refsect1.title: STATISTICS DATA
refsect1.para: The statistics data collected by the b10-xfrin daemon for Xfrin include:

listitem.simpara: A directory name of per-zone statistics
An actual zone name or special zone name _SERVER_ representing the entire server. Zone classes (e.g. IN, CH, HS) are mixed and counted so far. But these will be distinguished in future release.
Number of IPv4 SOA queries sent from Xfrin
Number of IPv6 SOA queries sent from Xfrin
Number of IPv4 AXFR requests sent from Xfrin
Number of IPv6 AXFR requests sent from Xfrin
Number of IPv4 IXFR requests sent from Xfrin
Number of IPv6 IXFR requests sent from Xfrin
Number of zone transfer requests succeeded
Number of zone transfer requests failed

Duration in seconds of the last successful AXFR. 0.0 means no successful AXFR done or means a successful AXFR done in less than a microsecond. If an AXFR is aborted due to some failure, this duration won't be updated.

Duration in seconds of the last successful IXFR. 0.0 means no successful IXFR done or means a successful IXFR done in less than a microsecond. If an IXFR is aborted due to some failure, this duration won't be updated.

refsect1.para: In per-zone counters the special zone name _SERVER_ exists. It doesn't mean a specific zone. It represents the entire server and the counter value of this special zone is the total of the same counter for all zones.
